name: Average Newcastle United Quiz | 10 Questions | Sports

questions.text: What year were Newcastle United founded?
questions.explanation:
1892.

	Newcastle East End and Newcastle West End merged to one club.

questions.text: Who was Newcastle United's fifth manager?
questions.explanation:
Doug Livingstone.

	He led the club from 1954-56.

St. James Park

	They have played at St. James Park since being founded.  It is the oldest and largest football stadium in the North East of England.

questions.text: What was the capacity of their home park in 2010?
questions.explanation:
52,387.

	The stadium has gone through many renovations over the past.

questions.text: On what date was Chris Hughton sacked?
questions.explanation:
December 2010.

	He was sacked after their 3-1 defeat to West Brom on December 6.

questions.text: What club does Newcastle United have a rivalry with?
questions.explanation:
Sunderland.

	They have been rivals since 1898.

questions.text: What were Newcastle United's original colors?
questions.explanation:
Red and White.

	They were originally red and white before changing to black and white.

questions.text: Who were they sponsored by from 1995 to 2000?
questions.explanation:
Newcastle Brown Ale.

	All the other options have sponsored the team also.

questions.text: Who won the Golden Boot for Newcastle in 1997?
questions.explanation:
Alan Shearer.

	Andy Cole had won the Golden Boot also in 1994.

questions.text: Which of the following is one of the team's nicknames?
questions.explanation:
The Magpies.

	Their other nickname is The Toon.
